Author: artem.pikulin#0794
ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: a spend of a spend of an unconfirmed spend does tend to be an issue now and then

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
```json
genie@NA_NN:~$ komodo-cli -ac_name=OOT getmempoolinfo
{
  "size": 0,
  "bytes": 0,
  "usage": 0
}
```
doesn't help either

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: if 75 peers (including most miners) don't see the tx (or any of them) then they aren't going into a block

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: This problem affects DEX UX badly. MM2 is designed to work with single UTXO without splits so it gets reused even unconfirmed to allow several concurrent swaps for the coin. If MM2 has to wait for confirmation every time it has to reuse the UTXO only 1 concurrent swap will be actually possible for a coin I think.

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: And yes, the problem is that mempool is not synced, I've seen this with BEER too. I've tried to run the mining node to find a block including these stuck transactions, but it didn't sync the mempool with other nodes.

Author: smk762#7640
Content: I've not seen it before.

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: So actually the node that has these transactions in mempool should mine them, it won't work otherwise.

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: or broadcast it to other miners/nodes

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: Yes, this too.

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: So as of now we should reimport these transactions to OOT mining node.

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: no need to "import", just send it out to the network

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: the more people that know about a tx is the more likely it is to be processed

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: Hmm, `electrum2.utrum.io:10088` is not aware about these transactions. I'm going to rebroadcast them to it now.

Content:
`electrum2.utrum.io:10088 is not aware about these transactions`
neither is the main block producer

Content: Done, let's see if this works out.

Content: 2 of the 3 are now in a block

Author: artem.pikulin#0794

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: not sure how to solve the underlying problem of it not being broadcast, but that is the issue: it either needs to be sent out to the network or mined by the tx creator

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: the 1st option seems more feasible using electrum

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: connect to any NN, and sendrawtransaction

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that should get a very good network coverage

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: @Oszy I've rebroadcasted your transactions to OOT chain and they are now mined. Your address is usable again.

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: Rebroadcasting is ok, but is it possible to avoid such situation by applying some fix to komodod? I've created the issue ref. this: https://github.com/jl777/komodo/issues/1790

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
`but is it possible to avoid such situation by applying some fix to komodod`
I'm not sure there's anything *to* "fix", other than what jl wrote

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: mempool is not guaranteed to be consistent across all nodes

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: Ok, but when transaction is in mempool for days, maybe there's a way to rebroadcast it to other peers automatically if possible?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, this would be possible, but would be too slow. i guess monitoring how long a tx is in the mempool and rebroadcasting if it is over 10 minutes, might be a good idea. but if the node is sparsely connected, it might not solve the problem

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
whatever the electrum equivalent of
`komodo-cli -ac_name=${chain} sendrawtransaction $(komodo-cli -ac_name=${chain} getrawtransaction ${tx})`
is, I imagine

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content:
`yes, this would be possible, but would be too slow. i guess monitoring how long a tx is in the mempool and rebroadcasting if it is over 10 minutes, might be a good idea. but if the node is sparsely connected, it might not solve the problem`
I see, maybe we should just wait and check how likely it will happen in the near future. If it happens rarely we can handle it manually, will not take much time for tech team. But if happens frequently we will need the workaround from komodod that will at least reduce the occurrence of such situation.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: caretaker nodes can just make sure all tx that have been broadcast confirm, i responded to issue with the idea

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: thanks guys

Author: phm87#7395
Content:
Do you have a documentation about how to redeem coins from a P2SH address? I read about scripts and P2SH addresses ( * ), I'm able to write some scripts that decode fine with decodescript rpc call but I'm still strugelling to redeem coins sent to the P2SH address. (I'm not talking about mm2 that works fine)
( * ) <https://zcash-rpc.github.io/signrawtransaction.html>
<https://medium.com/@bitaps.com/exploring-bitcoin-signing-p2sh-input-2dde869c5f5c>
<https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook/blob/develop/ch04.asciidoc#p2sh>
<https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Script>

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: http://www.righto.com/2014/02/bitcoins-hard-way-using-raw-bitcoin.html

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that should have all the details you need

Author: phm87#7395
Content: thank you

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I found other examples where they do a rawtx in hex with scriptSig (what I need to redeem from P2SH) but I'm still dreaming that I can use easy to use rpc calls and avoid to write the hex. I'll read details of the article you shared

Author: phm87#7395
Content: But maybe that only multisig have proper rpc calls and all other p2sh tx need to craft redeem tx in hex (I'm young, I'm still hoping that I can call signrawtransaction with the correct keys and redeem script and avoid to write that whole thing in hex)

Author: phm87#7395
Content: ```You cannot use Bitcoin Core to create your transaction because it does not know what to do with non-standard inputs. There is no need to use signrawtransaction because you are not signing anything. In order to make your transaction spendable, you will need to do it manually by inserting the scriptSig that you figured out yourself.``` <https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com/questions/72706/bitcoin-tx-sign-redeem-p2sh-transaction-unable-to-sign-input-invalid-stack-siz> Now I understand why you pointed raw tx
